spoon.sentence: Arya sipped at her tankard cautiously, between spoonfuls of pie still warm from the oven
spoon.basic:
英 [spuːn] 美 [spʊn]
n. 匙，勺子；一杓的量
vt. 用匙舀；使成匙状
vi. 轻轻向上击
spoon.collins:
* N-COUNT A spoon is an object used for eating, stirring, and serving food. One end of it is shaped like a shallow bowl and it has a long handle. 勺; 匙 例： He stirred his coffee with a spoon. 他用匙搅了搅咖啡。 
* V-T If you spoon food into something, you put it there with a spoon. 用勺舀; 用匙舀 例： He spooned instant coffee into two of the mugs. 他用勺把速溶咖啡舀进了两个杯子里。
spoon.phrase:
greasy spoon     低级小饭馆；经济小吃店
silver spoon     财富（尤指继承的遗产）；电影（集合名词）；电影业
wooden spoon     木匙；末名奖
soup spoon     汤匙
fork and spoon     叉子与勺子
tea spoon     茶匙儿，茶勺
spoon out     用匙舀

subterranean.basic:
英 [,sʌbtə'reɪnɪən] 美 [,sʌbtə'renɪən]
adj. 地下的；秘密的；隐蔽的
n. 地下工作者
subterranean.synonyms: adj. 地下的；秘密的；隐蔽的
subterranean.rel_word_tab:
词根： subterranean
adj.
subterraneous   地下的；隐匿的（等于 subterranean）
subterranean.sentence: 1) The vault opened onto one of the tunnels the brothers called the wormwalks, winding subterranean passages that linked the keeps and towers of Castle Black under the earth. 2) The vault opened onto one of the tunnels the brothers called the wormwalks, winding subterranean passages that linked the keeps and towers of Castle Black under the earth

breastplate.sentence: Smiths straightened swords, knocked dents from breastplates, and shoed destriers and pack mules alike
breastplate.synonyms: n. 护胸甲；胸革带；腹甲
breastplate.basic:
英 ['bres(t)pleɪt] 美 ['brɛst'plet]
n. 护胸甲；胸革带；腹甲
breastplate.collins: * N-COUNT A breastplate is a piece of armour that covers and protects the chest. 胸铠; 护胸甲
